p: In PC patients, BRAF (V600E) mutation status is an important diagnostic and prognostic biomarker for tumor aggressiveness and relapse [ 37]. We therefore screened all PC specimens for this mutation and identified 15 mutant and 27 wild-type cases (Supplementary file 1). Notably, neither PCA nor Euclidean distance-based hierarchical clustering identified any specific pattern associated with mutated or wild-type status BRAF V600E in the tumor samples ( FigureÂ 3). We found no differentially expressed genes with q < 0.1 by Wilcoxon test for the groups of BRAF (V600E) mutation positive and negative PCs.
